post.description: Retrieve a batch of workflows by ID.

get.description: Retrieve emails sent by a workflow by ID.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

post.description: Retrieve the IDs of v3 workflows that have been migrated to the v4 API.

get.description: Retrieve all workflows from an account.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

get.description: Retrieve all details for a specific workflow by ID.

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to retrieve.

delete.description: Fully delete a workflow by ID. Deleted workflows cannot be restored via the API. If you need to restore an accidentally deleted flow, you'll need to contact support.

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to delete.

outputFields.description: The list of output fields that this custom action makes available to the rest of the flow.

sourceCode.description: The source code to execute when this action executes.
sourceCode.example: def main(event):   # Use inputs to get data from any action in your workflow and use it in your code instead of having to use the HubSpot API.   email = event["inputFields"]["email"]   # Return the output data that can be used in later actions in your workflow.   return {     "outputFields": {       "email": email     }   }

runtime.description: The runtime to use to execute the source code. Supported runtimes are: "NODE16X", "NODE20X", "PYTHON39"

secretNames.description: The names of any "secrets" setup in this portal that will be used in this action.

type.description: The type of action this is, can be: "STATIC_BRANCH", "LIST_BRANCH", "AB_TEST_BRANCH", "CUSTOM_CODE", "WEBHOOK", or "SINGLE_CONNECTION"

dataKey.description: The output field name for that action

actionId.description: Which action to pull data from.

type.description: This is the type of input value. This can be one of: "FIELD_DATA", "OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_VALUE", "RELATIVE_DATETIME", "TIMESTAMP", "INCREMENT", "FETCHED_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "APPEND_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_APPEND_VALUE", "ENROLLMENT_EVENT_PROPERTY"

daysOfMonth.description: Which days of the month to run this workflow on.

type.description: The type of enrollment schedule this is, can be: "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "MONTHLY_SPECIFIC_DAYS", "MONTHLY_RELATIVE_DAYS", "YEARLY"

listFilterBranch.description: The list filter branch that represents the enrollment trigger to this flow.

reEnrollmentTriggersFilterBranches.description: A list of filter branches to listen for in order to re-enroll objects into this workflow.

unEnrollObjectsNotMeetingCriteria.description: Whether or not to remove objects from this workflow if they stop meeting the enrollment criteria.

shouldReEnroll.description: Whether or not the same object can enroll in this workflow twice.

type.description: The type of enrollment criteria this is, this can be "LIST_BASED", "EVENT_BASED", or "MANUAL".

actionTypeVersion.description: The version of this actionType to use.

fields.description: The fields to pass into this action. Different action types accept different fields.

appendPropertyName.description: The name of the property to append data from

filterBranch.description: The list criteria that determine when to execute this branch. The first matching branch will execute.

defaultBranchName.description: The name of the default branch, the branch that gets executed if the object does not match any of the `listBranch` criteria.

staticValue.description: A static value to use as the input

createdAt.description: The timestamp this flow was created.

objectTypeId.description: The CRM object type for objects that can be enrolled into this flow.

isEnabled.description: This controls whether or not the flow is "enabled" if it's actively listening for enrollment triggers and executing actions. If this is `false` the flow is not accepting any enrollments or executing any actions.

name.description: The user-provided name for this flow. Names get auto-created for workflows that are created without a name.

id.description: The unique ID for this flow. This is auto-generated when creating the flow.

uuid.description: An optional unique key for this flow. This is only unique per-portal.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp this flow was last updated.

secretName.description: The secret to pass through in this auth key.

name.description: The name to use for this auth key.

location.description: Where in the request this auth key should be located: "HEADER" or "QUERY_PARAM"

type.description: The type of webhook auth settings this is, can be: "AUTH_KEY" or "SIGNATURE"

propertyName.description: The property name to pull data from.

type.description: This is the type of input value. This can be one of: "FIELD_DATA", "OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_VALUE", "RELATIVE_DATETIME", "TIMESTAMP", "INCREMENT", "FETCHED_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "APPEND_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_APPEND_VALUE", "ENROLLMENT_EVENT_PROPERTY"

refinementCriteria.description: List-based criteria to further refine which contacts will enroll in this flow.

listMembershipFilterBranches.description: If you want to listen to list-membership events (an object was added to a list, an object was removed from a list) you need to use this `listMembershipFilterBranches` property instead of `eventFilterBranches`, because list membership events work differently.

shouldReEnroll.description: Whether or not the same object can enroll in this workflow twice.

type.description: The type of enrollment criteria this is, this can be "LIST_BASED", "EVENT_BASED", or "MANUAL".
The type of event anchor this is, can be: "CONTACT_PROPERTY_ANCHOR" or "STATIC_DATE_ANCHOR"

contactProperty.description: A date property on the contact to use as the anchor point of this workflow.

month.description: The month of the date to anchor on

year.description: The year of the date to anchor on. If this is not provided then this flow will re-run each year.

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the date to anchor on

type.description: The type of event anchor this is, can be: "CONTACT_PROPERTY_ANCHOR" or "STATIC_DATE_ANCHOR"

flowMigrationStatuses.description: The flowId from the V4 API
flowMigrationStatuses.example: The flowId from the V4 API

type.example: The type of input this is, can be FLOW_ID or WORKFLOW_ID

defaultBranchName.description: The name of the default branch, the branch that gets executed if `inputValue` does not match any of the `staticBranches`.

inputValue.description: The input value to branch off of.

type.description: The type of action this is, can be: "STATIC_BRANCH", "LIST_BRANCH", "AB_TEST_BRANCH", "CUSTOM_CODE", "WEBHOOK", or "SINGLE_CONNECTION"

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

propertyToken.description: The token to use to identify the object property to use

type.description: This is the type of input value. This can be one of: "FIELD_DATA", "OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_VALUE", "RELATIVE_DATETIME", "TIMESTAMP", "INCREMENT", "FETCHED_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "APPEND_OBJECT_PROPERTY", "STATIC_APPEND_VALUE", "ENROLLMENT_EVENT_PROPERTY"

method.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the webhook URL

type.description: The type of action this is, can be: "STATIC_BRANCH", "LIST_BRANCH", "AB_TEST_BRANCH", "CUSTOM_CODE", "WEBHOOK", or "SINGLE_CONNECTION"

authSettings.description: The type of auth to use when calling the webhook endpoint.

webhookUrl.description: The URL to call each time this action is executed.

flowIds.description: The IDs of the flows to unenroll an object in if it's enrolled in this flow.

type.description:
The type of unenrollment to perform:

"ALL" - unenroll the object from all other flows

"SELECTIVE" - only unenroll the object from the flows specified in `flowIds`

branchValue.description: If value to check for. If the value of the `inputValue` matches this `branchValue` than this `connection` will get traversed.

month.description: The month of the date each year to run this flow.

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the date each year to run this flow.

type.description: The type of enrollment schedule this is, can be: "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "MONTHLY_SPECIFIC_DAYS", "MONTHLY_RELATIVE_DAYS", "YEARLY"

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

appId.description: The appId that this signature will be generated for.

scopes.automation: Read from and write to my Workflows
